overview.overviewDescription: This three-day course provides participants with the knowledge and skills to establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) based on ISO 22301. overview.overviewDescription:
The Business Continuity Management 101 course provides a comprehensive and structured introduction to the principles, concepts, and practices of Business Continuity Management. Designed for professionals seeking to build awareness and establish foundational competencies, this course explores how organizations can prepare for, respond to, and recover from disruptive incidents with confidence. Participants will gain a solid understanding of the requirements of ISO 22301 and learn how it provides a framework for maintaining the continuity of critical operations and protecting vital assets
Through this program, learners will be introduced to the Business Continuity Lifecycle (Plan–Do–Check–Act), a systematic approach that ensures continuity strategies are not only planned but also implemented, tested, and continually improved. The course covers introduction to key components such as Incident Response Structure, Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Risk Assessment (RA), Strategy and Solutions, BCM Documentation, BCM Testing and many more, giving learners a holistic view of how continuity is developed, implemented, and maintained.
By the end of the course, learners will be equipped with the knowledge and insights needed to support resilience initiatives needed to safeguard your organization against potential disruptions.

keyHighlights: The course comprises 3 modules with 10 lesson areas.
Build a strong foundation in Business Continuity Management (BCM) concepts and fundamentals.
Gain practical understanding of ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) requirements.
Gain hands-on knowledge of BIA, Risk Assessment, and Continuity Strategies.
Learn how to create and manage BCM documentation, plans, and recovery procedures.
Appreciate the importance of testing, exercises, and continual improvement in strengthening resilience.
Understand how to evaluate BCMS performance through audits, reviews, and corrective actions.

prerequisites.title: Why Join This Course?
list: Gain a solid foundation in the basic fundamentals and concepts of Business Continuity Management.
Understand the requirements of ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management System (BCMS).
Understand the key stages of the Business Continuity Lifecycle.
Learn how risks and impacts on critical operations are identified and addressed.
Build awareness of effective continuity strategies and response arrangements.
Strengthen organizational readiness by appreciating the role of testing and continual improvement.

attendees: Professionals new to Business Continuity or Risk Management
Business Continuity and Risk Management Specialists.
Leaders, managers and supervisors responsible for business, operations or compliance.
IT, HR, Finance, Health &Safety, and Security staff supporting continuity and recovery efforts.
Anyone seeking foundational knowledge of ISO 22301 and BCM practices.
